020package com.bewsoftware.utils.io;
021
022import java.io.Closeable;
023
024/**
025 * This interface provides a means of displaying output in an abstract manner.
026 * <p>
027 * By using this interface, it is possible to have multiple implementations,
028 * each of which provides a different type or level of output. For instance,
029 * the {@link ConsoleIO} class provides console level output.
030 * <p>
031 * Also, by implementing most of the methods in the interface
032 * (<i>default</i> and <i>static</i>), it will make it even simpler to develop
033 * additional implementations.
034 *
035 * @implNote
036 * The ideas for the various methods, and even some of the implementation code
037 * for the <i>default</i> methods was derived from the
038 * {@link java.io.PrintStream}
039 * and {@link java.lang.StringBuilder} classes from JDK 15.
040 * <p>
041 * The reason for this, was to make it as close as possible to being a
042 * minimalist
043 * drop-in replacement for {@link java.lang.System#out}. Further more, by
044 * including
045 * methods from both classes, I believe it makes this class even more useful.
046 * <p>
047 * In addition to the methods derived from the above mentioned classes,
048 * I have included a few extra helper methods:
049 * <ul>
050 * <li>{@link #appendln(java.lang.String)}</li>
051 * <li>{@link #appendln(int)}</li>
052 * </ul>
053 *
054 * @author <a href="mailto:bw.opensource@yahoo.com">Bradley Willcott</a>
055 *
056 * @since 1.0.7
057 * @version 2.1.0
058 */
059public interface Display extends Closeable, Exceptions
060{
061
062    /**
063     * Adds the text to the internal buffer, much like with
064     * {@code StringBuilder}.
065     *
066     * @param text to be added
067     *
068     * @return this Display for chaining purposes
069     */
070    public Display append(final String text);
071
072    /**
073     * Empties the internal buffer of all unflushed output.
074     */
075    public void clear();
076
077    /**
078     * Get the debug level for this run.
079     *
080     * @return Debug level currently set
081     */
082    public int debugLevel();
083
084    /**
085     * Set the debug level for this run.
086     *
087     * @param level Debug level to use
088     */
089    public void debugLevel(int level);
090
091    /**
092     * Flushes all output from the internal buffer to the output destination(s).
093     */
094    public void flush();
095
096    /**
097     * Adds a formatted string to internal buffer using the specified
098     * format string and arguments.
099     *
100     * @param format The syntax of this string is implementation specific.
101     * @param args   Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format
102     *               string.
103     *
104     * @return this Display for chaining purposes
105     */
106    public Display format(String format, Object... args);
107
108    /**
109     * Display all following text if the {@linkplain #debugLevel(int) }
110     * is greater than or equal to the {@code level}.
111     *
112     * @param level The debug level at which to display the following text.
113     *
114     * @return this Display for chaining purposes
115     */
116    public Display level(int level);
117
118    /**
119     * Adds the text equivalent of the value to the internal buffer.
120     *
121     * @implNote
122     * Uses {@code value ? "true" : "false"} to convert value to String.
123     *
124     * @param value to print
125     *
126     * @return this Display for chaining purposes
127     *
128     * @see #append(java.lang.String)
129     */
130    default Display append(final boolean value)
131    {
132        return append(value ? "true" : "false");
133    }
134
135    /**
136     * Adds the number to the internal buffer.
137     *
138     * @implNote
139     * Uses {@code Integer.toString(number)} to convert int to String.
140     *
141     * @param number to print
142     *
143     * @return this Display for chaining purposes
144     *
145     * @see #append(java.lang.String)
146     */
147    default Display append(final int number)
148    {
149        return append(Integer.toString(number));
150    }
151
152    /**
153     * Adds the obj to the internal buffer.
154     *
155     * @implNote
156     * Uses {@code obj != null ? obj.toString() : "null"} to convert obj to
157     * String.
158     *
159     * @param obj to print
160     *
161     * @return this Display for chaining purposes
162     *
163     * @see #append(java.lang.String)
164     */
165    default Display append(final Object obj)
166    {
167        return append(obj != null ? obj.toString() : "null");
168    }
169
170    /**
171     * Add the System line separator to the internal buffer.
172     *
173     * @return this Display for chaining purposes
174     *
175     * @see #append(java.lang.String)
176     */
177    default Display appendln()
178    {
179        return append(System.lineSeparator());
180    }
181
182    /**
183     * Adds the text equivalent of the value to the internal buffer.
184     *
185     * @implNote
186     * Uses {@code value ? "true" : "false"} to convert value to String.
187     *
188     * @param value to print
189     *
190     * @return this Display for chaining purposes
191     *
192     * @see #appendln(java.lang.String)
193     */
194    default Display appendln(final boolean value)
195    {
196        return appendln(value ? "true" : "false");
197    }
198
199    /**
200     * Adds the number to the internal buffer, followed by the System line
201     * separator.
202     *
203     * @implNote
204     * Uses {@code Integer.toString(number)} to convert int to String.
205     *
206     * @param number to print
207     *
208     * @return this Display for chaining purposes
209     *
210     * @see #appendln(java.lang.String)
211     * @see java.lang.System#lineSeparator()
212     */
213    default Display appendln(final int number)
214    {
215        return appendln(Integer.toString(number));
216    }
217
218    /**
219     * Adds the obj to the internal buffer, followed by the System line
220     * separator.
221     *
222     * @implNote
223     * Uses {@code obj != null ? obj.toString() : "null"} to convert obj to
224     * String.
225     *
226     * @param obj to print
227     *
228     * @return this Display for chaining purposes
229     *
230     * @see #appendln(java.lang.String)
231     */
232    default Display appendln(final Object obj)
233    {
234        return appendln(obj != null ? obj.toString() : "null");
235    }
236
237    /**
238     * Adds the text to the internal buffer, followed by the System line
239     * separator.
240     *
241     * @param text to be added
242     *
243     * @return this Display for chaining purposes
244     *
245     * @see #append(java.lang.String)
246     * @see #appendln()
247     */
248    default Display appendln(final String text)
249    {
250        return append(text).appendln();
251    }
252
253    /**
254     * Prints the text equivalent of the value to the Display.
255     *
256     * @implNote
257     * Uses {@code value ? "true" : "false"} to convert boolean to String.
258     *
259     * @param value to print
260     *
261     * @see #print(java.lang.String)
262     */
263    default void print(final boolean value)
264    {
265        print(value ? "true" : "false");
266    }
267
268    /**
269     * Prints the number to the Display.
270     *
271     * @implNote
272     * Uses {@code Integer.toString(number)} to convert int to String.
273     *
274     * @param number to print
275     *
276     * @see #print(java.lang.String)
277     */
278    default void print(final int number)
279    {
280        print(Integer.toString(number));
281    }
282
283    /**
284     * Prints the object to the Display.
285     *
286     * @implNote
287     * Uses {@code obj != null ? obj.toString() : "null"} to convert the Object
288     * to String.
289     *
290     * @param obj to print
291     *
292     * @see #print(java.lang.String)
293     */
294    default void print(final Object obj)
295    {
296        print(obj != null ? obj.toString() : "null");
297    }
298
299    /**
300     * Prints the text to the Display.
301     *
302     * @param text to print
303     *
304     * @see #append(java.lang.String)
305     * @see #flush()
306     */
307    default void print(final String text)
308    {
309        append(text).flush();
310    }
311
312    /**
313     * Adds a formatted string to internal buffer using the specified
314     * format string and arguments.
315     *
316     * @param format The syntax of this string is implementation specific.
317     * @param args   Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format
318     *               string.
319     *
320     * @return this Display for chaining purposes
321     */
322    default Display printf(String format, Object... args)
323    {
324        return format(format, args);
325    }
326
327    /**
328     * Prints a line terminator to the Display.
329     */
330    default void println()
331    {
332        appendln().flush();
333    }
334
335    /**
336     * Prints the text equivalent of the value to the Display.
337     *
338     * @implNote
339     * Uses {@code value ? "true" : "false"} to convert boolean to String.
340     *
341     * @param value to print
342     *
343     * @see #println(java.lang.String)
344     */
345    default void println(final boolean value)
346    {
347        println(value ? "true" : "false");
348    }
349
350    /**
351     * Prints the number, followed by the System line separator, to the Display.
352     *
353     * @implNote
354     * Uses {@code Integer.toString(number)} to convert int to String.
355     *
356     * @param number to print
357     *
358     * @see #println(java.lang.String)
359     */
360    default void println(final int number)
361    {
362        println(Integer.toString(number));
363    }
364
365    /**
366     * Prints the object to the LCD Display.
367     *
368     * @implNote
369     * Uses {@code obj != null ? obj.toString() : "null"} to convert the Object
370     * to String.
371     *
372     * @param obj to print
373     *
374     * @see #println(java.lang.String)
375     */
376    default void println(final Object obj)
377    {
378        println(obj != null ? obj.toString() : "null");
379    }
380
381    /**
382     * Prints the text, followed by the System line separator, to the Display.
383     *
384     * @param text to print
385     *
386     * @see #appendln(java.lang.String)
387     * @see #flush()
388     */
389    default void println(final String text)
390    {
391        appendln(text).flush();
392    }
393}
